channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] OpenPages (openpages)
item.description: Simplify how you manage risk and regulatory compliance with a unified GRC platform fueled by AI and all your data.

item.title: [updated] Databases for DataStax (databases-for-cassandra) has changed the description of the plan named enterprise
item.description: *before*: One highly available DataStax instance with three data members. The Standard plan is priced based on disk storage, RAM, backup storage, and vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for DataStax instances have a minimum of 20GB of Disk, 12GB of RAM, and 6 cores per data member. , *after*: One highly available DataStax instance with three data members. The Standard plan is priced based on disk storage, RAM, backup storage, and vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for DataStax instances have a minimum of 20GB of Disk, 12GB of RAM, and 6 cores per data member.

item.title: [updated] Databases for EDB (databases-for-enterprisedb) has changed the description of the plan named standard
item.description: *before*: One highly available EDB instance with three data members. The Standard plan is priced based on disk storage, RAM, backup storage, and vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for EDB instances have a minimum of 20GB of Disk, 1GB of RAM, and 3 cores per data member. , *after*: One highly available EDB instance with three data members. The Standard plan is priced based on disk storage, RAM, backup storage, and vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for EDB instances have a minimum of 20GB of Disk, 1GB of RAM, and 3 cores per data member.

item.title: [lifecycle] File Storage for VPC (is.share) moved from Beta to Production Ready
[updated] watsonx Assistant (conversation) is the new name of Watson Assistant
[updated] Db2 (dashdb-for-transactions) was removed from the Osaka catalog
[updated] Virtual Server for VPC (is.instance) has a new plan named mz2-instance-dedicated-host
item.description: Pricing plan for zVSIs used by Dedicated Hosts for VPC Gen2

item.title: [updated] watsonx Code Assistant (code-assistant) has changed the description of the plan named essentials-z
item.description: *before*: The Essentials plan for IBM watsonx Code Assistant offers everything you need to translate COBOL to Java., *after*: The Essentials plan for IBM watsonx Code Assistant for Z as a Service, coupled with watsonx Code Assistant for Z (on prem), offers everything you need to translate COBOL to Java.

item.title: [updated] Cloud Object Storage (cloud-object-storage) was removed from the Dallas catalog
[updated] Cloud Object Storage (cloud-object-storage) was removed from the London catalog
[updated] watsonx Code Assistant (code-assistant) has changed the description of the plan named essentials-ansible
item.description: *before*: The Essentials plan for watsonx Code Assistant for Red Hat Ansible offers everything you need for Ansible code generation., *after*: The Essentials plan for watsonx Code Assistant for Red Hat Ansible Lightspeed offers everything you need for Ansible code generation.

item.title: [updated] watsonx Code Assistant (code-assistant) has changed the description of the plan named essentials-z
item.description: *before*: The Essentials plan for IBM watsonx Code Assistant for Z as a Service, coupled with watsonx Code Assistant for Z (on prem), offers everything you need to translate COBOL to Java., *after*: The Essentials plan for IBM watsonx Code Assistant offers everything you need to translate COBOL to Java.
